meanings.definition: To attract more people or customers than (someone or something else)
meanings.sent1: The new ice cream shop outdrew the old one with its colorful sign.
meanings.sent2: The popular movie outdrew all other films at the box office.
meanings.sent3: The magic show outdrew the circus in town, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her captivating storytelling outdrew the other speakers at the event.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle outdrew the competition, making it the top choice for consumers.

meanings.definition: To surpass in drawing or pulling out
meanings.sent1: The strong tug-of-war team outdrew their opponents with ease.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner outdrew all others in its ability to pick up dirt.
meanings.sent3: The fishing rod outdrew the old one by catching a bigger fish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's sketch outdrew all previous attempts, capturing the scene perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The new design outdrew the old one, showcasing improved functionality.
